title: Scale Model
prompt:
An architect made a scale drawing of a mall she is designing using a scale of
2 centimeters = 7.5 meters. In the drawing, the mall is 8.6 centimeters tall. How
tall is the actual mall?

Enter your answer as a decimal.
hint: The first coordinate is the horizontal distance; the second coordinate is the vertical distance.
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Start by writing a proportion, and let </mtext><mi>x</mi><mtext> equal the</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>unknown height of the actual mall: </mtext><mfrac>
     <mrow>
      <mn>2</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></mrow>
     <mrow>
      <mtext>7</mtext><mtext>.5 m</mtext></mrow>
    </mfrac>
    <mo>=</mo><mfrac>
     <mrow>
      <mn>8.6</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></mrow>
     <mrow>
      <mi>x</mi><mtext> m</mtext></mrow>
    </mfrac>
    <mo>.</mo>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Cross-multiply to solve for </mtext><mi>x</mi><mtext>:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>


<math display='block'>
 <mtable>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mn>2</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>7.5</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>8.6</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>64.5</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>32.25</mn><mtext> meters</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
